about.artworkDescription: This piece represents the journey of life, where each brushstroke tells a story of movement, growth, and the eternal quest for meaning. The interplay of colors captures the essence of wandering through both physical and emotional landscapes.
about.biographyCollections: His works can be seen at the Kyrgyz State Museum of Fine Art and in private collections throughout the CIS, USA, Germany, Turkey, and Great Britain.
about.biographyEducation: Bekten Usubaliev is a Kyrgyz painter who believes that art reveals the dreams, feelings, and independent spirit hidden within man. Not only does his artwork speak volumes, so does Bekten as a lecturer at the Kyrgyz State Art College, where he has taught since 1990. Born in 1958, he graduated from the Kyrgyz State Art College in 1981 and later earned a degree from the Repin Institute of Architecture, Sculpture, and Painting in St. Petersburg, Russia in 1989. He joined the Artists` Union of the Kyrgyz Republic in 1991.
about.biographyExhibitions: Bekten has shown his works in numerous national and international exhibitions, including a group exhibition of young artists in Almaty, Kazakhstan (1995); the second international biennale exhibition `Dialogues` in St. Petersburg, Russia (1995); the 70th anniversary celebration for Ch. Aitmatov in Brussels, Belgium (1997); an international exhibition in Teheran, Iran (2000); and a solo show in Bishkek (2001).
about.connectDescription: Ready to discuss art, commission a piece, or simply share your thoughts? I'd love to hear from you and explore how we can bring your artistic vision to life.
about.emotionDescription: Every brushstroke carries the weight of human feeling
about.journeyDescription: Discover the path that led me to become the artist I am today
about.metaDescription: ðŸŽ¨ Learn about Bekten Usubaliev's artistic journey, his philosophy, and his contributions to art. A painter who believes in the power of art to unveil the hidden realms of human emotions and dreams.
about.metaTitle: ðŸŽ¨ About Bekten Usubaliev - Kyrgyz Painter & Art Lecturer
about.philosophyDescription: My beliefs and approach to creating meaningful art
about.philosophyText: Art is not merely about creating beautiful images; it's about revealing the invisible threads that connect human experiences. Through my work, I strive to capture the essence of emotions that often remain unspoken, transforming them into visual narratives that resonate with the soul.
about.teachingDescription: Sharing knowledge and inspiring the next generation of artists
about.techniqueDescription: Mastering traditional methods while embracing innovation
about.featuredWorkDescription: One of my most celebrated pieces, showcasing the depth of human emotion through color and form

artist.defaultQuote: Art is the language of the soul, speaking truths that words cannot express.

privacyPolicyPage.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicyPage.additionalData: Data from additional relations: Accounts, Sessions, Artworks, Artwork Likes, Socials, Feedbacks, Press, and News.
privacyPolicyPage.changesNotification: Any changes to the privacy policy will be communicated via email.
privacyPolicyPage.rightsDescription: Users have the right to access, modify, and delete their personal information.
privacyPolicyPage.securityDescription: The website relies on services like Supabase, Prisma, and Vercel for security and operational functionality. No additional specific security measures are taken by bekten.art itself.
privacyPolicyPage.servicesPurpose: To facilitate services such as providing feedback to artists and showcasing artists' artworks on the website.
privacyPolicyPage.userDetails: Details from the User model: ID, Name, Email, Email Verified, Image, Profession, Description, Location, Role, Created At, Updated At, Share Data Preferences, and Email Subscription Preferences.
privacyPolicyPage.noThirdParty: Personal data is not shared with any third parties and is exclusively used for the functioning of bekten.art.

termsOfServicePage.title: Terms of Service
termsOfServicePage.disputeDescription: Disputes or concerns should be addressed to the website administrator or through the contact information provided.
termsOfServicePage.liabilityDescription: bekten.art is not liable for any direct or indirect consequences of user activities on the site.
termsOfServicePage.propertyDescription: Artworks and content displayed on the site are the property of their respective artists and protected under copyright laws.
termsOfServicePage.responsibilitiesDescription: Users are expected to abide by the rules of conduct on the site, respecting the intellectual property rights of artists and refraining from any form of harassment or abusive behavior.
termsOfServicePage.siteDescription: bekten.art is a platform showcasing artworks by various artists, including your father. It allows users to leave feedback on artist profiles and view artworks in a store section. The purchase of artworks is facilitated through direct communication with the artists, and no online transactions are conducted through the website.
termsOfServicePage.usageDescription: The website is designed for showcasing artworks and providing feedback to artists. Users are prohibited from posting offensive content, including but not limited to hate speech, pornography, and abusive language.

news.extendedContent1: This event represents another milestone in Bekten Usubaliev's distinguished career as one of Kyrgyzstan's most celebrated contemporary artists. With over 25 years of experience in the art world, Usubaliev continues to push the boundaries of traditional painting while honoring his cultural heritage.
news.extendedContent2: The artist's work has been featured in numerous international exhibitions, from Luxembourg and Hungary to Turkey, where his paintings were showcased as part of the TÃœRKSOY plein air program. His unique approach to oil painting combines classical techniques with modern sensibilities, creating works that speak to both local and global audiences.
news.extendedContent3: Visitors can expect to experience not just visual art, but a journey through the rich tapestry of Kyrgyz culture and the universal themes that connect all humanity. Each piece in the collection tells a story, inviting viewers to explore their own emotions and memories through the artist's masterful use of color, light, and composition.
news.followDescription: Follow Bekten Usubaliev's artistic journey and never miss an update.
